SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Load Data on the My Account Page More Efficiently

Cart and wishlist data now loads on the My Account page more efficiently. Storefront users can enjoy faster load times and a more responsive account management experience.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

How: The following changes support the improved performance:

The My Account page now fetches cart data when rendering CCRZ.views.myCartsView. Previously, the My Account page fetched the cart data when initializing the view.
The My Account page controller logic uses medium data sizing for ccrz.ccApiCart calls instead of extra large data sizing when populating My Carts.
The My Account page controller logic uses small data sizing for ccrz.ccApiWishlist calls instead of extra large data sizing when populating My Templates.

If you extended or replaced the Visualforce template for the My Account page, make sure that your custom code still handles the returned data correctly.

DID THIS ARTICLE SOLVE YOUR ISSUE?
Let us know so we can improve!

title: Improving Performance on My Account Page
